questions.question: A statement is true when it corresponds to reality.
We all share the same reality and only interpret it differently.
Truth depends on the opinions and beliefs of people.
People create words and define their meaning.
A statement is true if everyone agrees.
Strong belief, even without action, can change external reality.
Some beliefs should never be questioned.
Someone can be certain something is true yet still be mistaken.
A test that cannot identify a failure is a valid test.
If all members of a society share a belief, they are justified to hold that belief.
Believing something that is false feels just like believing something that is true.
Feelings are a reliable way to discover truth.
Believing something without evidence is admirable.
Without an explanation for something, any answer is better than no answer.
It is ok to accept something is true because it is comforting.
I give all claims the benefit of the doubt when I first encounter them.
Someone is justified in their beliefs until they are proven wrong.
The most important criteria for my beliefs is that they match reality.

groupName: When should we change our minds?

questions.question: I often investigate beliefs that do not match my own.
I am comfortable with saying: "I don't know".
It is beneficial to find out when I am wrong about something.
I will abandon a belief if I discover reliable information that falsifies it.
The more unusual the statement, the stronger the evidence needs to be.
It is possible that some of my beliefs are not true.
